meanings.definition: To warn or reprimand someone firmly.
meanings.sent1: Mom admonishes me when I forget to do my homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher admonishes the students for talking during class.
meanings.sent3: The cat admonishes the dog for stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds admonish the beachgoers to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's urgent tone admonishes everyone to evacuate immediately.

meanings.definition: To advise or urge someone earnestly.
meanings.sent1: Grandma admonishes me to always wear a jacket in cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The doctor admonishes his patients to quit smoking for better health.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl admonishes the young birds to listen to their elders.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun admonishes the travelers to find a safe place to rest.
meanings.sent5: The coach's passionate speech admonishes the team to give their all in the game.
